TopicTitle: [1.6.1] RealPlume - Stock [v1.3.1 - 1/14/19] - Better Late than Never Update

Articles.Content:
On 11/5/2016 at 3:39 PM, vimagar said:

The bug reported in the comments above has been happening to me too. Any grounded ship or base will jump up about 10 meters every time it is loaded from the tracking station or simply F9'ed. I'm really curious as to what in the code is causing it.

It happens to me as well.
I think it might be exasperated by lander size and/or mass, because it seems that it flings the (very large and heavy) mining landers I use much more than the small science probes I send in first to do surface resource scans.

Regarding the GIF of the problem I saw posted above, I saw something VERY odd in the debug log on the right side of that gif that may link to what exactly the problem is.

The line in question is:
"(Minmus Skycrane): Ground Contact! Error -7.993m" HOLY CARP you'd expect the thing to be jumping 8m in the air with a result like THAT !

The base right next to it shows up with a much more sane result:
"(Minmus Base(core): Ground Contact! Error -0.002m" As expected, this one didn't jump at all.

 

Something strange is going on here, for sure. I think I have no choice but to uninstall RealPlume stock until this bug is fixed.
Pity, it makes rocket launches look so nice, too.

1 hour ago, SciMan said:

It happens to me as well.
I think it might be exasperated by lander size and/or mass, because it seems that it flings the (very large and heavy) mining landers I use much more than the small science probes I send in first to do surface resource scans.

Regarding the GIF of the problem I saw posted above, I saw something VERY odd in the debug log on the right side of that gif that may link to what exactly the problem is.

The line in question is:
"(Minmus Skycrane): Ground Contact! Error -7.993m" HOLY CARP you'd expect the thing to be jumping 8m in the air with a result like THAT !

The base right next to it shows up with a much more sane result:
"(Minmus Base(core): Ground Contact! Error -0.002m" As expected, this one didn't jump at all.

 

Something strange is going on here, for sure. I think I have no choice but to uninstall RealPlume stock until this bug is fixed.
Pity, it makes rocket launches look so nice, too.

Unfortunately I can't do anything until the bug is fixed in SmokeScreen

Hmm... I just spent a fair bit of time removing and adding mods to try to figure out which one of them was causing my landed craft to flip over and explode when loading in.  I guess I should have checked the forum threads first.

On 17/11/2016 at 1:30 PM, Nhawks17 said:

Unfortunately I can't do anything until the bug is fixed in SmokeScreen  

I believe Sarbian just did that! the download link is in the smokescreen thread!

@Nhawks17 Our beloved @Felbourn made a more volumous version of SRB sounds for Shuttle. It has depth of the lower tones which shake the speakers, something not present in RealPlume SRBs.

I'm asking his permission and your consent to accept these shivering sounds to the RealPlume stock sounds for the "Kickback" SRB and massive boosters from other mods ("Solid-Lower" effect).

 

Edited November 19, 2016 by Enceos

Smoke screen just got updated and apparently the issue with the reentry particles is fixed

Edited November 19, 2016 by NeoFatalis
Exhaust particles no longer experience reentry effects, but the jumping landers is still an issue (with both RealPlume-Stock and HotRockets).
I also don't think the jumping vessels on load were fixed

I can confirm from very recent testing that the jumping vessels on load was not fixed.

I landed a brand new mining lander on Minmus that had this problem before the latest update to SmokeScreen (whichever version is/was bundled with RealPlume-Stock v0.11.0), and it still jumped exactly the same way with the new version of SmokeScreen (2.6.20.0).
Thanks for letting me know. I'll get an update out later today that includes the new SmokeScreen. Still can't do anything about the vessel jumping issue though

4 minutes ago, Nhawks17 said:

Thanks for letting me know. I'll get an update out later today that includes the new SmokeScreen. Still can't do anything about the vessel jumping issue though  

Oh I know I was just letting you know before you get bombarded with "why dis happen still?"

7 hours ago, Galileo said:

Oh I know I was just letting you know before you get bombarded with "why dis happen still?" 

Thank you good sir  I will actually have an update out tomorrow because I'm tired and can't feel my my legs
If anyone watching this thread has experienced the ship jumping issue with STOCK parts please post information AND A SAVE FILE to the SmokeScreen thread so Sarbian can debug the issue.
The ship-jumping bug seems to have been fixed.  Sarbian just posted an update.  I have not tested yet.

Yup! Going to test it now and then hopefully post an update.

Update! This includes the SmokeScreen fixes for the particle layer issues as well as the ship jumping issue! Thanks @sarbian for the fixes! Hope everyone enjoys as usual  

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

RealPlume-Stock v0.11.1

- Updated SmokeScreen
- Updated Module Manager

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

No more unintended explosions

@Nhawks17 I got a weird one where liquid fuel rockets load in graphically on.    I'm thinking it was just a goober on multiple versions of moduel manager , but just in case is there any know incompatible mods?

Just now, NemesisBosseret said:

@Nhawks17 I got a weird one where liquid fuel rockets load in graphically on.    I'm thinking it was just a goober on multiple versions of moduel manager , but just in case is there any know incompatible mods?

All known compatible mods are listed in the OP. What do you mean by they "load in graphically on"?

Load on launch pad "on" (flames shooting out) but producing no thrust    stage and they work but smoke was not produced 

I'm thinking it was my fault for not double checking my game data folder,  reloading now so in about 20 mins I'll know lol

1 minute ago, NemesisBosseret said:

Load on launch pad "on" (flames shooting out) but producing no thrust    stage and they work but smoke was not produced 

I'm thinking it was my fault for not double checking my game data folder,  reloading now so in about 20 mins I'll know lol

Ohh okay I see what you're saying. I haven't experienced that myself so let me know if it still happens.

Ugh.... nope,    it's comming from something with real plume and I don't know what..      this sucks.    I'll paste my mod list in a sec
